Hi, I'm Jamie Billing. I'm a senior lecturer
in product design at Nottingham Trent University

10.text:
in the UK. I'm also a technical design director
of Co-oproduct CIC, which is an open design

17.text:
portal that focuses on sustainable an ethical
design issues and resources.

24.text:
The tools that I engage with most on sustainability
workshop were the improving product lifetime

31.text:
tools. All the reference guides and the videos
were absolutely brilliant.

36.text:
I make my students aware all of the Autodesk
Sustainability Workshop tools from the onset.

41.text:
It covers very simply, but very intelligently
design for disassembly, design for repair,

49.text:
and design for recycling, as well as design
for remanufacturing and design for upgrade.

54.text:
I always run more than one design project
with students that focuses on sustainability

60.text:
or ethical design practice.
And this year, we ran a project that looked

67.text:
at mass manufactured kettles and toasters.
And we got the students to reverse engineer

73.text:
and disassemble cheap kettles and toasters.
And what the Autodesk tools provide is really

79.text:
simple techniques and processes that you can
implement during the design process to make

86.text:
products more sustainable.
And by using the quick reference guide, we

90.text:
could very easily isolate things like, instead
of using 15 different screw threads, or screw

96.text:
heads, or attachments for the casing of a
toaster, actually you can just choose one,

102.text:
which is really easy. Which means that, for
example, when it comes to the end of its life

107.text:
and it needs to be disassembled to be streamed
into the correct waste streams that it wouldn't

113.text:
take very long to take apart.
What the students go out the process is a

117.text:
very quick realization that designing products
sustainability and ethically, doing things

126.text:
the right way, and considering the environment,
is not impossible, in fact, it's really easy.

133.text:
Very quickly, the tools give them the confidence
to innovate in a profession where perhaps

141.text: we don't innovate as much as we could.
